column5: Our view changed drastically overnight, there is still some ice on the main part of the lake, but it will be gone quickly. ice-out is a month early, I will end up walleye season in the boat.
Could be deceptive, but the water level doesn't look particularly low. Have you had some rain?

That photo of the lake is deceptive, the picture only shows high rock shoreline with a steep drop. I just walked down to our small bay (adjacent to the house) to see if it was possible to float the boat and/or plane out in the water via the rail systems, it is very doubtful. The drainage tile shown in the pictures is now around 2 feet above the lake level, normally at this time of year tile is a foot or more below the surface. We need rain.
with rain weare getting in the north west right now will improve the situation a bit.
It's really dry here as well & hoping for some rain too. Looking forward to seeing some pictures this spring John.

Trying to do some shore fishing but conditions still aren't right.Did find some open water yesterday and cast off the bank and got a couple pike.Felt good to hav√® a summer rod in my hand.Had a otter visit in my second spot.
With less than normal rain fall seemingly comes a higher risk of forest fires, hope the rain comes. Bill

We have been having rain last couple days Bill.Looks like a few more days yet.Woods were very dry so now they got some moisture your right dont need any fires yet.I can live with low water but hate fires.
Looks likes a healthy little gator,the fish are probably eating better than the people in Canada,beside you john
